title: Arthur Smith: Growing up in a family of three sons, I found females utterly mysterious
text:
We asked the writer and comedian, 64, what his younger self would make of his life

I was a road sweeper for six months after leaving university, when I was 21 or 22 years old. At the same age, my father had been captured at El Alamein, which I was very much aware of. He had quite a Second World War. After being captured, he was held in Colditz Castle, and because of that I had a lot of cachet with the other kids. We would run round the bomb sites of Bermondsey, pretending we were fighting the Japs and the Jerries, as they used to be known. My father, who was a copper by then, was on the beat.

Despite the cachet and despite playing those games with the other kids, I never saw myself following...
description: We asked the writer and comedian, 64, what his younger self would make of his life
